question:
Which among the following statements is/are correct about Urbanization in India?
  1. According to the Census conducted in 1901, only 11.4% of the Indian population used to live in urban areas.
  2. The significant rise in urban population was observed post-independence scenario.
Select the correct code from the options given below:
explanation: According to the Census conducted in 1901, only 11.4% of the Indian population used to live in urban areas. This figure gradually rose to 30% in the 21st century. The significant rise in urban population was observed post-independence scenario. India adopted for itself a mixed economy, as a result of which the private sector bloomed which ultimately facilitated the rise of urbanisation.
